comments:
THis bug has been already reported but there was no resolution noted.
I get the error message at cvs update after I switched from CVS on linux to CVSNT. I have set all the compatibility flags, without success. The entry to the log is:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 2006-09-11 09:31:42.294
!MESSAGE Problems reported while synchronizing CVS Workspace. 0 of 1 resources were synchronized.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 2006-09-11 09:31:42.294
!MESSAGE An error occurred synchronizing /Cube/com/ios/common: The following warnings were reported while performing the "cvs update" command.
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSException: The following warnings were reported while performing the "cvs update" command.
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.UpdateContentCachingService.cacheFileContents(UpdateContentCachingService.java:206)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.UpdateContentCachingService.buildRemoteTree(UpdateContentCachingService.java:105)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.CVSWorkspaceRoot.getRemoteTree(CVSWorkspaceRoot.java:176)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSResourceVariantTree.fetchVariant(CVSResourceVariantTree.java:82)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.AbstractResourceVariantTree.refresh(AbstractResourceVariantTree.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSResourceVariantTree.refresh(CVSResourceVariantTree.java:330)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.AbstractResourceVariantTree.refresh(AbstractResourceVariantTree.java:55)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.refresh(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:162)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.refresh(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.Subscriber.refresh(Subscriber.java:459)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSWorkspaceSubscriber.refreshWithContentFetch(CVSWorkspaceSubscriber.java:434)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.mappings.WorkspaceSubscriberContext.refresh(WorkspaceSubscriberContext.java:305)
	at org.eclipse.team.ui.synchronize.ModelParticipantMergeOperation.initializeContext(ModelParticipantMergeOperation.java:71)
	at org.eclipse.team.ui.synchronize.ModelMergeOperation.execute(ModelMergeOperation.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.team.ui.synchronize.ModelParticipantMergeOperation.execute(ModelParticipantMergeOperation.java:88)
	at org.eclipse.team.ui.synchronize.ModelOperation.run(ModelOperation.java:106)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.JobRunnableContext.run(JobRunnableContext.java:144)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.JobRunnableContext$ResourceJob.runInWorkspace(JobRunnableContext.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 1 2006-09-11 09:31:42.294
!MESSAGE The following warnings were reported while performing the "cvs update" command.
!SUBENTRY 3 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 -14 2006-09-11 09:31:42.294
!MESSAGE common: cvs server: cannot open directory . for empty check: No such file or directory

When I issure cvs on the command line (delivered with tortoiseCVS) it works correctly. What to do?

One thing you can do is try the latest 3.2.1 release candidate build. Other people who have reported the problem have claimed that it does not occur with that build. I assume you have the "Act as a 1.11.2 server" option of CVSNT set? If so, the fact that it worked for you with Linux CVS and fails with CVSNT indicates to me that CVSNT is not behaving properly with the option set. Let me know how the 3.2.1 build goes and, if there is still a problem, we can determine the best course of action from there.

traces.message: The following warnings were reported while performing the "cvs update" command.
